User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Content Spark application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

platform.description: The user's primary content platform (e.g., Instagram, YouTube).

contentNiche.description: The user's content niche (e.g., fitness, travel, tech).

growthGoal.description: The user's primary growth goal (e.g., reach, engagement, consistency).

Creator.title: Creator
Creator.description: Represents a content creator's public profile for collaboration matching.

primaryPlatform.description: Main platform for content (e.g., YouTube, Instagram).

contentStrengths.description: List of the creator's key content skills (e.g., 'Video Editing', 'Storytelling').

collaborationInterests.description: Types of collaborations the creator is open to.

availability.description: Indicates if the creator is currently open to collaboration requests.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the creator profile was created.

CollaborationRequest.title: CollaborationRequest
CollaborationRequest.description: Represents a collaboration request sent from one creator to another.

senderId.description: The user ID of the creator sending the request.

receiverId.description: The user ID of the creator receiving the request.

matchScore.description: The AI-calculated match score between the two creators.

status.description: The current status of the collaboration request.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the request was sent.

BrandProfile.title: BrandProfile
BrandProfile.description: Represents the user's brand profile, including tone, target audience, and mission.

id.description: Unique identifier for the brand profile.

brandTone.description: The overall tone of the brand (e.g., professional, funny, casual).

targetAudience.description: Description of the brand's target audience.

coreMission.description: The core mission statement of the brand.

ContentLog.title: ContentLog
ContentLog.description: Represents a log of generated content, including the raw idea, AI-generated post, and image prompt.

id.description: Unique identifier for the content log.

rawIdea.description: The user's initial raw idea for the content.

aiGeneratedPost.description: The AI-generated social media post in JSON format, containing strategic rationale, platform-optimized text, and hashtags.

imagePrompt.description: The AI-generated image prompt for the post.

platform.description: The platform the content was generated for (e.g., LinkedIn, Instagram, X).

createdDate.description: Date and time the content was created.

ContentCalendarEntry.title: ContentCalendarEntry
ContentCalendarEntry.description: Represents an entry in the content calendar, including the date, content log, and platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the content calendar entry.

scheduledDate.description: The date the content is scheduled to be posted.

platform.description: The platform the content is scheduled for (e.g., LinkedIn, Instagram, X).

Trend.title: Trend
Trend.description: Represents a trending topic within a specific niche.

niche.description: The niche this trend belongs to (e.g., fitness, travel, tech).

strategicRationale.description: A strategic explanation of why this trend is relevant and how to capitalize on it.

hashtags.description: Array of relevant hashtags for the trend.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User data and associated content are organized under user-specific paths for private data, enabling simple and secure rules based on `request.auth.uid`. The new `creators` collection stores public-facing profiles for collaboration, readable by any authenticated user if `availability` is true. The `collaboration_requests` collection is at the root to manage interactions between users, with security rules ensuring only the sender or receiver can access a specific request, thus protecting privacy while enabling the feature.
